issue.title: SeaDrive + Win11 = failed to read request from shell extension: The pipe has been ended.
issue.body: Hello! First off: really messy install. You're asking for a cache directory but still create %userprofile%\seafile and dump stuff in there like logs. Could be much cleaner if you put everything in the path you asked me to define. That way the path I expect to contain everything about seafile actually does. Secondly, seadrive will not download a single thing. It updates windows explorer icons to the blue syncing icon but nothing moves. No status reported in the GUI, no error displayed. You have to go dig through the log to get to the issue. Not a user-friendly approach if we're going to call something GUI. Is it ready for windows 11 or did I jump the gun? Is SeaDrive abandonware? Should I actually use the standalone sync client instead? Not very clear on your site. Here's the `seadrive-gui.log`: ``` [10/22/23 13:29:29] starting applet rpc service [10/22/23 13:29:29] applet rpc service started [10/22/23 13:29:29] seadrive gui started [10/22/23 13:29:29] loaded 0 accounts [10/22/23 13:29:29] Using cache directory: C:\Users\me\Documents\seadrive_cache [10/22/23 13:29:29] starting seadrive daemon: seadrive.exe "-d" "C:/Users/me/seadrive/data" "-l" "C:/Users/me/seadrive/logs/seadrive.log" "C:\\Users\\me\\Documents\\seadrive_cache" [10/22/23 13:29:32] [ext listener] listening on \\.\pipe\seadrive_ext_pipe_bWU= [10/22/23 13:30:47] Unable to get config value download_limit: Config not exists [10/22/23 13:30:47] Unable to get config value upload_limit: Config not exists [10/22/23 13:30:47] Unable to get config value delete_confirm_threshold: Config not exists [10/22/23 13:33:23] failed to parse file path: "C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf" [10/22/23 13:33:23] [ext] invalid path C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf [10/22/23 13:33:26] failed to parse file path: "C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf" [10/22/23 13:33:26] [ext] invalid path C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf [10/22/23 13:33:28] failed to parse file path: "C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf" [10/22/23 13:33:28] [ext] invalid path C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf [10/22/23 13:33:29] failed to parse file path: "C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf" [10/22/23 13:33:29] [ext] invalid path C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf [10/22/23 13:33:34] failed to read request from shell extension: The pipe has been ended. [10/22/23 13:45:34] failed to parse file path: "C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf" [10/22/23 13:45:34] [ext] invalid path C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf [10/22/23 13:45:36] failed to parse file path: "C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf" [10/22/23 13:45:36] [ext] invalid path C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf [10/22/23 13:45:37] failed to parse file path: "C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf" [10/22/23 13:45:37] [ext] invalid path C:/Users/me/Documents/seadrive_cache/admin/My Libraries/Folder/S1/Some.pdf [10/22/23 13:45:42] failed to read request from shell extension: The pipe has been ended. ``` Other than that I'm just testing out your software. I'm not sure why but you chose to go the scattered documentation way. Maybe because you don't have someone to maintain them? Not sure. But finding how to get a full suite of seafile going via docker for example is 50% manual labor. And there's no penetrance for your features. For example what the heck is SeaDoc? How do I read about it? Its features? What does it look like? Is it useful to me? How do I know? And if I decide to try it out I have manually update files which apparently get overwritten with the next version of the docker container?! 🤷‍♂️ Very odd choices. Lots to clean up. Also, "documentation moved here" is 1990. Just redirect.

comment.body: I wiped seadrive and switched to the basic system tray client because it wasn't syncing. I do remember perusing the logs and the seadrive.log had basic stuff like some service started or listening or similar. Nothing interesting there. In fact I couldn't get to the bottom of it on my own which is why I reached out. Doesn't seem like you have come across this much either, so it could be an isolated thing. If you want me to run a debug version or something similar I'd be happy to help.

comment.body: It should be some issues with your client or server environment. You can check seadrive.log for more useful information. The client works on most of our users' computers.

issue.title: SeaDrive + Win11 = failed to read request from shell extension: The pipe has been ended.

Could be much cleaner if you put everything in the path you asked me to define. That way the path I expect to contain everything about seafile actually does. Secondly, seadrive will not download a single thing. It updates windows explorer icons to the blue syncing icon but nothing moves. No status reported in the GUI, no error displayed. You have to go dig through the log to get to the issue. Not a user-friendly approach if we're going to call something GUI. Is it ready for windows 11 or did I jump the gun? Is SeaDrive abandonware? Should I actually use the standalone sync client instead? Not very clear on your site. I'm not sure why but you chose to go the scattered documentation way. Maybe because you don't have someone to maintain them? Not sure. But finding how to get a full suite of seafile going via docker for example is 50% manual labor. And there's no penetrance for your features. For example what the heck is SeaDoc? How do I read about it? Its features? What does it look like? Is it useful to me? How do I know? And if I decide to try it out I have manually update files which apparently get overwritten with the next version of the docker container?! 🤷‍♂️ Very odd choices. Lots to clean up. Also, "documentation moved here" is 1990. Just redirect.

release.name: v9.0.4
release.body:
## What's Changed
* Add sync error SYNC_ERROR_ID_CHECKOUT_FILE by @feiniks in https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/pull/1479
* Add block missing sync error by @feiniks in https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/pull/1480

* Update i18n by @rumtid in https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/pull/1486
* Fix compatible issues on Qt6 framework by @rumtid in https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/pull/1487


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/compare/v9.0.3...v9.0.4

issue.title: Tag GitHub releases
issue.body:
Would it be possible for you to start making GitHub releases again? For some reason you stopped making them with `v6.2.4-testing`.

I maintain the `seafile` package for *Solus*. Without GitHub releases I have to manually check if new releases were made, because I can only subscribe to be notified of releases not tags. I am sure the maintainers of the `seafile` package for other distributions would appreciate this as well.

issue.title: Tag GitHub releases
issue.body:
Would it be possible for you to start making GitHub releases again? For some reason you stopped making them with `v6.2.4-testing`.

I maintain the `seafile` package for *Solus*. Without GitHub releases I have to manually check if new releases were made, because I can only subscribe to be notified of releases not tags. I am sure the maintainers of the `seafile` package for other distributions would appreciate this as well.

comment.body: Thanks for the suggestion. We'll update and maintain the releases from now on. For now we just use the vx.y.z tags to tag the releases.

issue.title: Tag GitHub releases
issue.body:
Would it be possible for you to start making GitHub releases again? For some reason you stopped making them with `v6.2.4-testing`.

I maintain the `seafile` package for *Solus*. Without GitHub releases I have to manually check if new releases were made, because I can only subscribe to be notified of releases not tags. I am sure the maintainers of the `seafile` package for other distributions would appreciate this as well.

comment.body:
I am Arch user and I came to ask the same thing. the [latest released version](https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/releases/tag/v6.2.4-testing) is from 2018-08-24 (5 years, 1 month, and 26 days ago). There have been improvements to this project but they are not reflected  properly to the end user if they don't do the source check:

![image](https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/assets/390889/286f5b25-cdbc-4786-aa44-1ab73883af37)


It would be very handy if you add GitHub actions for:
1. checking if the latest commit is built successfully
2. makes a release when (version is changed && build is successful). This can also merge the master into a branch (e.g named "stable") so that package maintainers can pull from it.

issue.body:
Would it be possible for you to start making GitHub releases again? For some reason you stopped making them with `v6.2.4-testing`.

I maintain the `seafile` package for *Solus*. Without GitHub releases I have to manually check if new releases were made, because I can only subscribe to be notified of releases not tags. I am sure the maintainers of the `seafile` package for other distributions would appreciate this as well.

issue.title: Ubuntu上使用单点登录，提示“SSL握手失败”
issue.body:
使用Ubuntu23.04操作系统，用点的登录方式，登录学校云盘。提示SSL握手失败。如下图。

![image](https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/assets/7907975/c1353c4b-0513-40f6-a051-97396966cb4d)

comment.body:
> 这个可能跟学校的证书有关，不支持这个操作系统。可以联系学校解决一下。也可以试一下用浏览器访问是否能成功。

浏览器能访问成功。谢谢。我再试试其他办法吧

issue.title: can seafile web-ui and server intergrate oss like aliyun oss sdk
can seafile web-ui and server intergrate oss like aliyun oss sdk

comment.body: Pro edition can integrate with OSS.

issue.title: Explorer extension bugs
issue.body:
As we can see in this image the arrow to the right is missing. I think this confuses many users because one cannot know that there is a sub menu.
![seafile bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5340585/10558907/1bd6546c-74e2-11e5-9b65-fdca512009ed.png)

Furthermore when getting a share link or an internal share link the window containing the link is opened in the background. I think it should come to the front.

I'm using windows 10. At least the missing arrow bug is also there on windows 7 and 8 and 8.1.

issue.title: authentication window does not support webauthn
issue.body:
We delegate the authentication to our identity provider (IDP) via SAML and support Webauthn as a second factor.

The browser-window that Seafile opens for the authentication process does not support webauthn (it completely ignores both the platform authenticator (windows hello) and FIDO2-tokens connected via USB.

We tested this on GNU/Linux and Windows.

One way to solve this would be to open the login-window in the default browser of the operating system. (This is how e.g. element-desktop does it.) Alternatively it may help to update the integrated browser.

keywords: fido2, webauthn, u2f, fido, saml, oidc, openid connect, delegated authentication

comment.body: In version 11 we will provide an option to use web browser from desktop to open SSO window. That should solve the issue.

issue.title: Linux CLI client error: Couldn't prepare query, error:1->'no such table: Certs'
issue.body: As mentioned in https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/issues/1348 these error messages should be suppressed at least in seafile-cli_4.3.2_xx.tar.gz which has no GUI. They are harmless but are filling up the logs, and so we have to stick to version 4.0.4 Maybe seaf-cli could load the certificates or don't try to do that when there is no table to store them.

comment.body:
# from : https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/blob/5bc61af6ad2bfd39d0c6da6cc90ac16d62ad3150/src/certs-mgr.cpp#L69
```
Locate the certs.db file. It is in the same location than config.db,, branch.db, ...
sqlite3 certs.db
sqlite> CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS Certs (url VARCHAR(255) PRIMARY KEY, cert TEXT);
sqlite> exit
```
no more error message

issue.title: [Bug] Interface theming issue on dark desktop theme
issue.body:
I'm on Linux Mint 18.3 (AKA Ubuntu 16.04 with Cinnamon) with the beautiful dark Mint-Y theme.

The Seafile Desktop Client is themed light, which is not a problem, but it should either style every element, or none at all.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1702193/44468705-1c62b880-a626-11e8-9aaa-f4ed9aeca2ec.png)

As you can see, now there is a Frankenstein mix of Seafile custom (light) elements and system (dark) elements.

comment.body: Same in Kubuntu 22.04 LTS. Client version 9.0.4

issue.title: Fix app not moving in wayland by using the startSystemMove() method
issue.body:
Fixes #991, where the app could not be moved under wayland because the protocol does not allow windows to move themselves. This method was introduced in qt 5.15 and [is currently recommended when using client-side decorations](https://www.qt.io/blog/custom-window-decorations) as it allows for native look and feel. 

I have only tested this under under wayland and xwayland but it should be a drop-in replacement in Windows, Linux and Macos. Testing would be appreciated nonetheless.

comment.body: This does fix the problem for me in the latest KDE/Wayland under Arch.  It would be nice if it was merged.

issue.title: [Improvement] Windows - more visible indicators on tray icon
issue.body:
Current status indicators (tick and exclemation mark) are not easy distinguishable, depending on display resolution/size.

![image](https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/assets/70302993/1e84e7b8-259d-4e0b-9b09-ba9fefc79bf4) ![image](https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/assets/70302993/84c70637-4401-41ed-a2cd-00b17797bef0)

Coloring (and maybe enlarging) the indicators would help a lot. E.g. a green check mark and a red exclamation mark.
Apparently this is already done on MacOS so: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile-client/issues/727
